flawed_nl_solution:
If Emerie has six quarters, Zain has 6+10 = <<6+10=21>>21 quarters.
At the same time, Zain has 7+10 = <<7+10=17>>17 dimes, ten more than Emerie.
The total number of quarters and dimes Zain has is 17+21 = <<17+21=38>>38 coins.
Zain also has 10 more nickels than Emerie, a total of 10+5 = <<10+5=15>>15 nickels.
In total, Zain has 38+15 = <<38+15=53>>53 coins.
#### 53

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 21. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
